title: CholeS Score for Duration of Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy
description: Predicts operative time duration for elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy procedures

result.name: choles_score
result.description: CholeS score and operative duration risk prediction

ranges.interpretation: 5.1% chance of surgery lasting >90 minutes. Suitable for standard operative scheduling with 3 cases per half-day list.
5.1-41.8% chance of surgery lasting >90 minutes. Consider scheduling 2-3 cases per half-day list based on total risk.
>41.8% chance of surgery lasting >90 minutes. Schedule maximum 2 cases per half-day list to avoid overruns.

references: Nassar AHM, Hodson J, Ng HJ, Vohra RS, Katbeh T, Zino S, et al. Predicting the difficult laparoscopic cholecystectomy: development and validation of a pre-operative risk score using an objective operative difficulty grading system. Surg Endosc. 2020 Oct;34(10):4549-4561.
Griffiths EA, Hodson J, Vohra RS, Marriott P, Katbeh T, Zino S, et al. Utilisation of an operative difficulty grading scale for laparoscopic cholecystectomy. Surg Endosc. 2019 Jan;33(1):110-121.

Vohra RS, Pasquali S, Kirkham JJ, Marriott P, Johnstone M, Spreadborough P, et al. The development and validation of a scoring tool to predict the operative duration of elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy. Surg Endosc. 2018 Jul;32(7):3149-3157.
formula: Score = Age points + Gender points + Indication points + BMI points + CBD points + GB wall points + CT points + Cholangiogram points + Previous admissions points + ASA points
notes: Developed from CholeS study data (8820 patients, 166 UK hospitals)
Only applicable to elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy
Not validated for emergency or acute cholecystectomy
Area under ROC curve: 0.708 for >90 minute surgery prediction
Helps optimize theatre scheduling and resource allocation
Does not account for anesthesia time or theatre turnover
